name: stroke()
content:
Sets the color used to draw lines, points and outline shapes.

The stroke color controls the color of lines, points and outline of shapes drawn - `arc()`, `ellipse()`, `rect()`, `regularPolygon()`, `shape()`. The fill color for shapes is set using `fill()`. Until you change the stroke, Game Lab will continue to draw with the color that you set.

The _color_ parameter can take one of two forms. It can be:

- The lowercase name of a color inside " ".  A full list of color names can be found at [W3 Schools - Colors](http://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp)
- A call to the `rgb()` command.

The default fill color is black.

examples.name: Basketweave
examples.description: Draw random colored lines in a square basketweave pattern.

examples.name: Jackson Pollock
examples.description: Use the mouse pointer position to place random lines and points.

examples.name: 2 Ways
examples.description: Demonstrate the two ways to specify the color parameter.

palette_params.name: color
palette_params.description: The color used to draw lines and points or a call to the rgb() command.

return_value: No return value. Changes future output to the display only.
short_description: Sets the color used to draw lines, points and outline shapes.
tips:
- The default stroke is black, the default stroke weight is 1 pixel, and the default fill is gray. Change the width of the line and color of the fill used to draw all subsequent shapes using `strokeWeight()` and `fill()`.
- A full list of color names can be found at [W3 Schools - Colors](http://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp).
- For more specific color selection, or to randomize color selection, use `rgb()` as a parameter to stroke instead of a color name.
